page.title: 01Stanton-under-Bardon
page.content: First mentioned in the{Domesday Book {of 1085}the village is nine miles north-west from Leicester and eight south-west from Loughborough, only one mile south-west of the M.1 motorway junction 22 with the A50 Leicester to Stoke-on-Trent road. The{population is slowly declining and there are{approximately 500 people living in and around the village today.Most of the land is{farmed}and the village is overlooked by the Cliffe Hill Quarry, which has produced {granite}since about 1860. Many of the houses in the village date back to{Victorian}times, although some council property was built in the 1960's and some private dwelling in the 1970's.There is a{primary school in the village itself and a{secondary {school}nearby.
